column4: I'm running ubuntu 11.10 with a lxde DE.  The battery monitor in lxde is stuck at 100% but the gnome power manager is working accurately.  Anyone know how I can fix the lxde battery monitor so it can work properly?
I'm running a separate battery monitor so I can monitor my battery level lol
Why not just disable the LXDE one and run batti or whatever it is you're running only?
thats what I currently have going but it runs behind all my windows... its not in plain sight... its not too big of a deal, just wondering if someone knows a fix
